availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Leonidas B. Peters (Woodford County, Kentucky, clerk and postmaster)

body.p: Woodford County, Kentucky, clerk and postmaster. Kentucky native. Married to Ermine K. Creel Peters in Woodford County on June 9, 1853. Father of Fannie Peters, Charles Peters, Roger H. Peters, and Walker Peters. Clerk in Woodford County in 1850. Clerk in Woodford County in 1860. Postmaster in Woodford County in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Woodford County, District 2, p. 460A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Woodford County, Versailles, p. 833.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Woodford County, Versailles, p. 523B.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Woodford County Marriages, Film #000482707, p. 434 of 495 on microfilm (accessed via Ancestry.com).
Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registration Records (Provost Marshal General's Bureau; Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865), NARA RG 110, Records of the Provost Marshal General's Bureau (Civil War), Consolidated Enrollment Lists, 1863-1865 (Civil War Union Draft Records), Woodford County, KY, June1863, p. 75 (accessed via Ancestry.com).
